019package org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager;
020
021import com.google.gson.reflect.TypeToken;
022import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiClient;
023import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException;
024import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.apis.ApisApi;
025import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.apis.CustomObjectsApi;
026import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1APIGroup;
027import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1APIResource;
028import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1GroupVersionForDiscovery;
029import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1Namespace;
030import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1ObjectMeta;
031import io.kubernetes.client.util.Config;
032import io.kubernetes.client.util.Watch;
033import io.kubernetes.client.util.generic.dynamic.DynamicKubernetesApi;
034import io.kubernetes.client.util.generic.options.ListOptions;
035import java.io.IOException;
036import java.nio.file.Files;
037import java.nio.file.Path;
038import java.time.Duration;
039import java.time.Instant;
040import java.util.HashSet;
041import java.util.LinkedList;
042import java.util.List;
043import java.util.Map;
044import java.util.Set;
045import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
046import java.util.logging.Level;
047import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.APP_NAME;
048import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.VM_OP_GROUP;
049import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.VM_OP_KIND_VM;
050import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.VM_OP_NAME;
051
052import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmChannel;
053import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmDefChanged;
054import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmDefChanged.Type;
055import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
056import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
057import org.jgrapes.core.Components;
058import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
059import org.jgrapes.core.events.Start;
060import org.jgrapes.core.events.Stop;
061import org.jgrapes.util.events.ConfigurationUpdate;
062
063/**
064 * Watches for changes of VM definitions.
065 */
066@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
067public class VmWatcher extends Component {
068
069    private String namespaceToWatch;
070    private final Map<String, VmChannel> channels = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
071
072    /**
073     * Instantiates a new VM definition watcher.
074     *
075     * @param componentChannel the component channel
076     */
077    public VmWatcher(Channel componentChannel) {
078        super(componentChannel);
079    }
080
081    /**
082     * Configure the component.
083     *
084     * @param event the event
085     */
086    @Handler
087    public void onConfigurationUpdate(ConfigurationUpdate event) {
088        event.structured(Components.manager(parent()).componentPath())
089            .ifPresent(c -> {
090                if (c.containsKey("namespace")) {
091                    namespaceToWatch = (String) c.get("namespace");
092                }
093            });
094    }
095
096    /**
097     * Handle the start event.
098     *
099     * @param event the event
100     * @throws IOException 
101     * @throws ApiException 
102     */
103    @Handler(priority = 10)
104    public void onStart(Start event) throws IOException, ApiException {
105        // Get namespace
106        if (namespaceToWatch == null) {
107            var path = Path
108                .of("/var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/namespace");
109            if (Files.isReadable(path)) {
110                namespaceToWatch = Files.lines(path).findFirst().orElse(null);
111            }
112        }
113        if (namespaceToWatch == null) {
114            logger.severe(() -> "Namespace to watch not configured and"
115                + " no file in kubernetes directory.");
116            event.cancel(true);
117            fire(new Stop());
118            return;
119        }
120        logger
121            .fine(() -> "Controlling namespace \"" + namespaceToWatch + "\".");
122
123        // Get all our API versions
124        var client = Config.defaultClient();
125        var apis = new ApisApi(client).getAPIVersions();
126        var vmOpApiVersions = apis.getGroups().stream()
127            .filter(g -> g.getName().equals(VM_OP_GROUP)).findFirst()
128            .map(V1APIGroup::getVersions).stream().flatMap(l -> l.stream())
129            .map(V1GroupVersionForDiscovery::getVersion).toList();
130
131        // Remove left overs
132        var coa = new CustomObjectsApi(client);
133        purge(client, coa, vmOpApiVersions);
134
135        // Start a watcher thread for each existing CRD version.
136        // The watcher will send us an "ADDED" for each existing VM.
137        for (var version : vmOpApiVersions) {
138            coa.getAPIResources(VM_OP_GROUP, version)
139                .getResources().stream()
140                .filter(r -> VM_OP_KIND_VM.equals(r.getKind()))
141                .findFirst()
142                .ifPresent(crd -> watchVmDefs(crd, version));
143        }
144    }
145
146    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops",
147        "PMD.CognitiveComplexity" })
148    private void purge(ApiClient client, CustomObjectsApi coa,
149            List<String> vmOpApiVersions) throws ApiException {
150        // Get existing CRs (VMs)
151        Set<String> known = new HashSet<>();
152        for (var version : vmOpApiVersions) {
153            // Get all known CR instances.
154            coa.getAPIResources(VM_OP_GROUP, version)
155                .getResources().stream()
156                .filter(r -> VM_OP_KIND_VM.equals(r.getKind()))
157                .findFirst()
158                .ifPresent(crd -> known.addAll(getKnown(client, crd, version)));
159        }
160
161        ListOptions opts = new ListOptions();
162        opts.setLabelSelector(
163            "app.kubernetes.io/managed-by=" + VM_OP_NAME + ","
164                + "app.kubernetes.io/name=" + APP_NAME);
165        for (String resource : List.of("apps/v1/statefulsets",
166            "v1/configmaps", "v1/secrets")) {
167            var resParts = new LinkedList<>(List.of(resource.split("/")));
168            var group = resParts.size() == 3 ? resParts.poll() : "";
169            var version = resParts.poll();
170            var plural = resParts.poll();
171            // Get resources, selected by label
172            @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops")
173            var api = new DynamicKubernetesApi(group, version, plural, client);
174            var listObj = api.list(namespaceToWatch, opts).getObject();
175            if (listObj == null) {
176                continue;
177            }
178            for (var obj : listObj.getItems()) {
179                String instance = obj.getMetadata().getLabels()
180                    .get("app.kubernetes.io/instance");
181                if (!known.contains(instance)) {
182                    var resName = obj.getMetadata().getName();
183                    var result = api.delete(namespaceToWatch, resName);
184                    if (!result.isSuccess()) {
185                        logger.warning(() -> "Cannot cleanup resource \""
186                            + resName + "\": " + result.toString());
187                    }
188                }
189            }
190        }
191    }
192
193    private Set<String> getKnown(ApiClient client, V1APIResource crd,
194            String version) {
195        Set<String> result = new HashSet<>();
196        var api = new DynamicKubernetesApi(VM_OP_GROUP, version,
197            crd.getName(), client);
198        for (var item : api.list(namespaceToWatch).getObject().getItems()) {
199            if (!VM_OP_KIND_VM.equals(item.getKind())) {
200                continue;
201            }
202            result.add(item.getMetadata().getName());
203        }
204        return result;
205    }
206
207    private void watchVmDefs(V1APIResource crd, String version) {
208        @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops",
209            "PMD.AvoidCatchingThrowable", "PMD.AvoidCatchingGenericException" })
210        var watcher = new Thread(() -> {
211            try {
212                // Watch sometimes terminates without apparent reason.
213                while (true) {
214                    Instant startedAt = Instant.now();
215                    var client = Config.defaultClient();
216                    var coa = new CustomObjectsApi(client);
217                    var call = coa.listNamespacedCustomObjectCall(VM_OP_GROUP,
218                        version, namespaceToWatch, crd.getName(), null, false,
219                        null, null, null, null, null, null, null, true, null);
220                    try (Watch<V1Namespace> watch
221                        = Watch.createWatch(client, call,
222                            new TypeToken<Watch.Response<V1Namespace>>() {
223                            }.getType())) {
224                        for (Watch.Response<V1Namespace> item : watch) {
225                            handleVmDefinitionChange(crd, item);
226                        }
227                    } catch (IOException | ApiException | RuntimeException e) {
228                        logger.log(Level.FINE, e, () -> "Problem watching \""
229                            + crd.getName() + "\" (will retry): "
230                            + e.getMessage());
231                        delayRestart(startedAt);
232                    }
233                }
234            } catch (Throwable e) {
235                logger.log(Level.SEVERE, e, () -> "Probem watching: "
236                    + e.getMessage());
237            }
238            fire(new Stop());
239        });
240        watcher.setDaemon(true);
241        watcher.start();
242    }
243
244    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidLiteralsInIfCondition")
245    private void delayRestart(Instant started) {
246        var runningFor = Duration
247            .between(started, Instant.now()).toMillis();
248        if (runningFor < 5000) {
249            logger.log(Level.FINE, () -> "Waiting... ");
250            try {
251                Thread.sleep(5000 - runningFor);
252            } catch (InterruptedException e1) { // NOPMD
253                // Retry
254            }
255            logger.log(Level.FINE, () -> "Retrying");
256        }
257    }
258
259    private void handleVmDefinitionChange(V1APIResource vmsCrd,
260            Watch.Response<V1Namespace> item) {
261        V1ObjectMeta metadata = item.object.getMetadata();
262        VmChannel channel = channels.computeIfAbsent(metadata.getName(),
263            k -> {
264                try {
265                    return new VmChannel(channel(), newEventPipeline(),
266                        Config.defaultClient());
267                } catch (IOException e) {
268                    logger.log(Level.SEVERE, e, () -> "Failed to create client"
269                        + " for handling changes: " + e.getMessage());
270                    return null;
271                }
272            });
273        if (channel == null) {
274            return;
275        }
276
277        // Filter duplicates
278        if (!"DELETED".equals(item.type) && !channel
279            .setGeneration(item.object.getMetadata().getGeneration())) {
280            return;
281        }
282        channel.pipeline().fire(new VmDefChanged(VmDefChanged.Type
283            .valueOf(item.type), vmsCrd, item.object), channel);
284    }
285
286    /**
287     * Remove VM channel when VM is deleted.
288     *
289     * @param event the event
290     * @param channel the channel
291     */
292    @Handler(priority = -10_000)
293    public void onVmDefChanged(VmDefChanged event, VmChannel channel) {
294        if (event.type() == Type.DELETED) {
295            channels.remove(event.object().getMetadata().getName());
296        }
297    }
298
299}
